analysisInProgress.message: Analysis in progress. Start browsing the web, then come back here to get stats!

topTraffic.message: Top 5 traffic related to your browsing

digitalEquivalenceTitle.message: The CO2 emissions related to your digital use is equivalent to:

equivalenceTitle.message: In $MINUTES$ minutes of browsing, you have downloaded $MBTOTAL$ MB of data. This required $KWH$ kWh of electricity, or $GCO2$ gCO2e

selectRegionHelp.message: Not required but the result will be more relevant.

howToChange.message: How to change that? What responsibility?

tab_history_data_consumptionShareAmongSi.message: Data comsumption repartition between web sites

tab_history_data_consumptionOverTime_tit.message: Smoothed data consumption over the time

settingsLastRefresh.message: Last carbon intensity factors refresh at $TIME$.

tab_history_data_consumptionOverTime_des.message: Represent data transferts during your browsing. This measurement allows you to estimate at what point in your navigation you are using the most data.

tab_history_data_consumptionShareAmongSi.message: Represents the distribution of your data consumption according to the sites. A large part shows that you use a site frequently or that the site in question requires a lot of data.

tab_history_electricity_overTime_title.message: Comsumption of electricity linked to your online activity (not only your computer)

tab_history_electricity_overTime_descrip.message: Represents the instantaneous electricity consumption during your navigation. The amount of electricity includes the electricity used by the data center to maintain the web page but also the electricity consumed by the routing infrastructure between you and the site. High peaks can show that you are using a power-hungry site (for example if it is not optimized or uses unnecessary effects for the user).

tab_history_attention_time_title.message: Share of your time among sites.

tab_history_attention_time_description.message: Represents your time while browsing, high bars indicate that you spend a lot of time on the given site.

tab_history_attention_efficiency_descrip.message: The more bar is high the more site is efficient. Sites that got a low value consume many bytes for few of your time (it could be a wrongly optimized, or a site that do useless things for instance in background).

tab_settings_preferencesScreen_prefs_dae.message: interval (ms) at which we write the storage
latency that apply when preferences have been changed
interval at which we check for download end (ms).

tab_settings_preferencesScreen_prefs_tab.message: Latency to apply when graph resize is triggered (in ms).
Threshold for attention time do not show anything below that (in ms).
Delay (ms) after which we consider user has finished editing.

tab_settings_preferencesScreen_prefs_gen.message: latency induced for storage fetch by guis (ms)
